programme.title: Body of Deceit
programme.desc: Alice (Kristanna Loken) is a ghostwriter for a famous author. She is halfway through the work of his new book, but cannot write anymore. A year has passed since she had a terrible accident in Malta where she was staying with her husband Max (Antonio Cupo) in his family villa and was in a coma for two weeks. Since then, she has been suffering from depression and has recurrent and cryptic nightmares. Max persuades her to go back to Malta in the hopes that something will unblock her mind so she can start working again and meet her deadline.(n)

programme.title: Away From Her
programme.desc: A lovingly devoted couple feel their unshakable longtime bond begin to unravel thanks to the ravages of Alzheimer's Disease in this remarkable tour-de-force of acting and powerfully emotional writing from first-time director Sarah Polley. Gordon Pinsent, Julie Christie and Olympia Dukakis star.(n)

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: Shortly after arriving to help colonize Mars, an astronaut dies while giving birth to the first human born on the red planet, unable to reveal who the father is. The child, Gardner Elliot, is an inquisitive, highly intelligent boy who reaches the age of 16 having only met 14 people in his life. While searching for clues about his father, and the home planet he's never known, Gardner begins an online friendship with a street-smart girl named Tulsa. He arrives on Earth, eager to experience all of the wonders he's only read about.(n)

programme.title: Certain Women
programme.desc: Michelle Williams, Kristen Stewart and Laura Dern star as three women striving to forge their own paths amidst the wide-open plains of the American Northwest. The lawyer (Dern) finds herself contending with both office sexism and a hostage situation. The wife and mother (Williams) has determination to build her dream home which puts her at odds with the men in her life. The young law student (Stewart) forms an ambiguous bond with a lonely ranch hand (Lily Gladstone).(n)

programme.title: The Dog Lover
programme.desc: Sara Gold is a young girl on a quest to save man's best friend. When she goes undercover to take down a dog breeder suspected of wrongdoing, she quickly finds out she might be on the wrong side of right. Sara must make a decision: to continue and follow the orders of her organization, United Animal Protection Agency, or trust her instincts and the boy she's fallen in love with.(n)

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Persuasion
programme.desc: When high school student Kimberly Joyce accuses her English teacher of sexual harassment, she turns her exclusive Beverly Hills private school, and everything else in her wake, upside down. Hell hath no fury like a teenager scorned.(n)

programme.title: Bad Moms
programme.desc: Over-worked, over-committed and exhausted, Amy joins forces with two other stressed moms on a quest to liberate themselves from conventional responsibilities - going on a long overdue binge of freedom and fun that puts them on a collision course with the head of the PTA and her clique of perfect moms.(n)

programme.title: Certain Women
programme.desc: Michelle Williams, Kristen Stewart and Laura Dern star as three women striving to forge their own paths amidst the wide-open plains of the American Northwest. The lawyer (Dern) finds herself contending with both office sexism and a hostage situation. The wife and mother (Williams) has determination to build her dream home which puts her at odds with the men in her life. The young law student (Stewart) forms an ambiguous bond with a lonely ranch hand (Lily Gladstone).(n)

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.(n)

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: Three criminals attempt to steal an army shipment of gold bars from a moving locomotive in 19th-century England. (cc).

programme.title: Hanover Street
programme.desc: A Yank pilot (Harrison Ford) romances a British nurse (Lesley-Anne Down) during WWII. Christopher Plummer is the husband gone off to war. Trumbo: Alec McCowen. Jerry: Richard Masur. Martin: Michael Sacks. Harry: Max Wall. Directed by Peter Hyams. (cc).

programme.title: From Beyond the Grave
programme.desc: A quartet of horror tales centered on an eerie antique shop. Donald Pleasence, Margaret Leighton, David Warner, Ian Carmichael, Peter Cushing, Diana Dors, Ian Bannen, Lesley-Anne Down. Directed by Kevin Connor. (cc).

programme.title: Floral Japan
programme.desc: "Traveltalks" visits Japan for a look at the country's flourishing gardens, including its cherry-blossom trees and tulips. Also: how to properly wear a kimono. Narrated by James A. Fitzpatrick.

programme.title: Funeral Parade of Roses
programme.desc: A look at a love triangle in a gay bar in Tokyo. (cc).

programme.title: Crazed Fruit
programme.desc: Two brothers fall for a woman with an agenda. (cc).

programme.title: Dating Do's and Don'ts
programme.desc: Instructions are given for teen daters.

programme.title: Some of the Greatest
programme.desc: A compilation of scenes from the 1926 silent classic "Don Juan," starring John Barrymore.

programme.title: The Son of Monte Cristo
programme.desc: The Grand Duchess of Lichtenburg seeks help from a masked hero to oust the despot who has taken over her country.

programme.title: Land Beyond the Law *
programme.desc: Dick Foran plays a singing cowboy who comes to the aid of victimized homesteaders in an oater capped by a dandy gunfight. Dave Massey: Wayne Morris. Louise: Linda Perry. Cattle Kate: Irene Franklin. (cc).

programme.title: That Mothers Might Live *
programme.desc: A profile of Ignaz Philipp Semmelweis (Sheppard Strudwick), a pioneering 19th-century Hungarian physician who discovered that, by washing their hands before treating new mothers, doctors could reduce the risk of death. Directed by Fred Zinnemann.

programme.title: I Love My Mother-in-Law, But ... *
programme.desc: A husband (Dave O'Brien, who also wrote and directed) tries his best to get along with his wife's sometimes difficult mother (Anne O'Neal). Narrated by Pete Smith. (cc).

programme.title: Tarzan and the Leopard Woman
programme.desc: The jungle man sets out to break up a warlike tribe who dress in leopard skins. Johnny Weissmuller, Brenda Joyce, Johnny Sheffield, Acquanetta. Kimba: Tommy Cook. Lazar: Edgar Barrier. Commissioner: Dennis Hoey. Kurt Neumann directed.

programme.title: Teddy the Rough Rider
programme.desc: Oscar-winning short biopic chronicling the political and military career of Theodore Roosevelt (Sidney Blackmer) from 1895, when he was named New York City police commissioner, to his appointment as President after the 1901 assassination of President McKinley. Blackmer portrayed Roosevelt in six other films.

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone
programme.desc: During World War II, a crack team of six commandos undertakes a suicide mission to destroy two massive German guns that guard a strategic channel in the Aegean Sea and block Allied passage. (cc).

programme.title: The FBI Story
programme.desc: The story of the FBI is told from the perspective of one agent as he investigates such nefarious groups as gangsters, Nazis, Cold War spies, and the Klu Klux Klan. (cc).

programme.title: The Lion in Winter
programme.desc: Adaptation of the play about royal-family intrigue in 1183 involving King Henry II, his estranged wife Eleanor of Aquitaine and their three sons who make up the line of succession. (cc).

programme.title: The Fortune Cookie
programme.desc: An unscrupulous lawyer tries to win a hefty verdict after a cameraman is injured while filming a football game when a player runs into him. The attorney has his client exaggerate his injuries, which leads to the guilty-feeling football player waiting hand and foot on the client. (cc).

programme.title: The Running Man
programme.desc: With the help of his wife, the owner of a small air-transport company fakes his death as a means of getting back at the insurance company who denied an earlier claim because he was one day late in making his payment.

programme.title: Caged
programme.desc: Contact with criminals in a prison transforms a young woman into an embittered convict, where she fights to survive among brutal and hardened inmates. Eleanor Parker was nominated for Best Actress as the imprisoned woman and Hope Emerson received a Best Supporting Actress nod as the institution's sadistic matron. The screenplay was also Oscar nominated. (cc).

programme.title: Brewster McCloud
programme.desc: Robert Altman's fantasy about a youth (Bud Cort) who inhabits a remote section of the Houston Astrodome and wants to fly like a bird. Louise: Sally Kellerman. Shaft: Michael Murphy. Weeks: William Windom. Susanne: Shelley Duvall. Lecturer: Rene Auberjonois. Wright: Stacy Keach. Daphne: Margaret Hamilton. Altman's unconventional follow-up to "MASH." (cc).

programme.title: Every Girl's Dream
programme.desc: Actress Nancy Bernard models costumes. Also included: Doris Day and Rod Taylor in wardrobe fittings.

programme.title: Grey Gardens
programme.desc: The Maysles brothers' portrait of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis' aunt and cousin, Edith Bouvier Beale and daughter Edie, former socialites who have become recluses in a deteriorating home in East Hampton, N.Y. (cc).

programme.title: Gypsy Sweetheart
programme.desc: A singing gypsy (Winifred Shaw) and her caravan cohorts are invited to entertain at a garden party on an estate and wind up taking over the place, but the guests accuse them of stealing.

programme.title: So Big
programme.desc: A Midwestern farm woman falls in love with a Dutch student in a Chicago boarding school following her father's death. (cc).

programme.title: Pocketful of Miracles
programme.desc: A boozy, unkempt apple seller in Depression-era New York learns her long-overseas daughter, who believes her to be a wealthy dowager, is returning with her fiancé to visit, so the old gal gets help from a gangster in transforming into a society matron. Frank Capra retooled his own 1933 hit "Lady for a Day" for this Runyonesque yarn. The film's title tune was nominated for a Best Song Oscar. (cc).

programme.title: Caged
programme.desc: Contact with criminals in a prison transforms a young woman into an embittered convict, where she fights to survive among brutal and hardened inmates. Eleanor Parker was nominated for Best Actress as the imprisoned woman and Hope Emerson received a Best Supporting Actress nod as the institution's sadistic matron. The screenplay was also Oscar nominated. (cc).

programme.title: Bachelor Mother
programme.desc: When a man mistakes a pretty, fun-loving department-store clerk for the mother of a foundling baby, he becomes determined to keep mom and child together, much to her dismay. (cc).

programme.title: Light in the Piazza
programme.desc: An overly protective American mother takes her beautiful but mentally unstable daughter on a tour of Italy, where the young woman falls for a cultured young man in Florence. (cc).(c)

programme.title: A Letter From a Soldier
programme.desc: A serviceman on leave visits a dead comrade's mother to deliver his final letter. Keefe Brasselle, Marjorie Main. Directed by Don Weis.(c)

programme.title: Sounder
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee concerns dirt-poor black sharecroppers during the Depression who face adversity when the father is jailed for stealing to feed his family, leaving his wife to struggle to care for their three children and tend to the farm. Paul Winfield and Cicely Tyson were Oscar-nominated as the parents, and the film received a nod for Best Adapted Screenplay. (cc).

programme.title: I Remember Mama
programme.desc: Best Actress nominee Irene Dunne stars as the wise and tender matriarch of a Norwegian-immigrant family in early 1900s San Francisco, where the eldest daughter narrates from her diary and details their history of successes, trials and failures. An excellent ensemble cast features Best Supporting Actress nominees Barbara Bel Geddes and Ellen Corby, and Supporting Actor nominee Oscar Homolka. (cc).

programme.title: Mildred Pierce
programme.desc: Joan Crawford won an Academy Award as a spurned housewife struggling to care for her two daughters: a lovable tomboy and a scheming, social-climbing teen who almost drives her to ruin. The film, an adaptation of James M. Cain's novel, was nominated for Best Picture. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Stella Dallas
programme.desc: This consummate soap opera is about a working-class woman who marries a wealthy socialite but separates from him when she realizes she'll never fit in with his crowd. Through the years she tries desperately to build a better life for their daughter. As the mother and daughter, Barbara Stanwyck and Anne Shirley were nominated for Best Actress and Best Supporting Actress, respectively. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Mickey
programme.desc: An orphan raised in a mining town is sent to live with an aunt who eagerly takes her in thinking the young girl is wealthy. Upon learning she is penniless, the woman forces her to work as a servant.(n)

programme.title: Women in Hiding
programme.desc: This entry in the "Crime Does Not Pay" series examines illegal medical clinics that cater to unwed mothers and offer inexpensive services that include dangerously inadequate care and illegal adoptions. Marsha Hunt, Jane Drummond. Directed by Joseph M. Newman.(n)

programme.title: Danton
programme.desc: Director Andrzej Wajda's epic about French Revolution rivals Georges Danton (Gerard Depardieu) and Maximilien Robespierre (Wojciech Pszoniak).(n)

programme.title: A Generation
programme.desc: Andrzej Wajda ("Ashes and Diamonds," "Kanal") directed this study of wartime Poland during the German Occupation. Tadeusz Lomnicki. Dorota: Urszula Modrzynska. Jasio: Tadeusz Janczar. Sekula: Janusz Paluszkiewicz. Mundek: Roman Polanski. Jacek: Ryszard Kotas.(n)

programme.title: Don Juan
programme.desc: John Barrymore had one of his great silent roles in this account of the legendary lover, set in Renaissance Italy. Adriana: Mary Astor. Pedrillo: Willard Louis. Lucretia Borgia: Estelle Taylor. Cesare Borgia: Warner Oland. Donati: Montagu Love. Maia: Myrna Loy. Rena: Helene Costello. Beatrice: Jane Winton. Leandro: John Roche. Nehri: Gustav von Seyffertitz. The first silent with music and sound effects.(n)

programme.title: Captain Kidd
programme.desc: Captain Kidd coaxes King William III into appointing him the protector of a valuable treasure ship. Meanwhile, Kidd intends to steal the ship's cargo for himself with the aid of his scheming lieutenants. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The King's Thief
programme.desc: A wicked duke's scheme to assassinate his enemies at court based on fabricated accusations of treason is discovered by a noblewoman and a charming highwayman. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Sea Hawk
programme.desc: A daring buccaneer during the reign of Elizabeth I plunders the seas on behalf of the crown. But, after seizing a Spanish galleon, trouble brews in the form of an espionage plot and the Spanish ambassador's lovely niece. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Scaramouche
programme.desc: In 18th-century France, a roguish ne'er-do-well masquerades as an actor in a plot to avenge the death of his friend who was killed during a duel with a master swordsman. The film is famous for one of the longest sword fights in cinema history. Lewis Stone costars as Georges de Valmorin and played villainous Marquis de la Tour d'Azyr in the 1923 silent version. programme.desc: Ellen Ripley is back in the "Alien" saga's fourth installment. Here she returns from the dead, courtesy of cloning, to battle more vicious beasts. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: From Hell
programme.desc: Johnny Depp plays an opium-addicted inspector who uses his clairvoyant powers to try to track down Jack the Ripper in 19th-century London. Heather Graham, Ian Holm, Ian Richardson, Robbie Coltrane, Lesley Sharp. Directed by Albert and Allen Hughes. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Snatched
programme.desc: A free-spirited woman convinces her anxious mother to join her on a vacation to South America she'd been planning with her beau before they broke up. However, their trip turns into a wild adventure when they escape from an attempted kidnapping. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: From Mexico With Love
programme.desc: Self-destructive migrant laborer Hector Villa (Kuno Becker) seeks to follow in his father's footsteps by making a name for himself as an amateur boxer. When Hector's mother dies, he vows to honor her memory by defeating the toughest boxer around. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Mechanic Resurrection
programme.desc: Hit man Arthur Bishop is forced to come out of retirement and commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover. The hardest part: He must make all of the killings look like accidents. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Half Past Dead
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent tries to infiltrate a powerful crime ring. But when a bust goes bad, he lands in the recently reopened, high-tech Alcatraz, where he remains undercover as thieves try to find a cache of stolen gold. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: An eccentric scientist builds a time machine, which accidentally transports a high-school student back to the 1950s, where the teen inadvertently interferes with the budding romance between his future parents. The boy must figure out how to set things right, or risk completely altering the future. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Live by Night
programme.desc: Joe Coughlin, the son of a Boston police lieutenant, moves to Florida during the Prohibition era to become a bootlegger. As his operation grows, Coughlin faces off against local gangsters, Klansmen and religious evangelicals while he fights for control of Tampa's criminal underworld. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: When Mark Whitacre discovers that his company is involved in price-fixing, he becomes an informant for the FBI. Convinced he'll be hailed as a hero for his efforts, he agrees to wear a wire and gathers evidence to convict his bosses. Unfortunately, both the case and Whitacre's integrity are compromised when the FBI agents discover that he isn't the saintly figure he made himself out to be. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: All the Real Girls
programme.desc: A small-town lothario (Paul Schneider) tries to change his ways when he falls in love with his best friend's 18-year-old sister (Zooey Deschanel). Slow paced, but well-acted. Patricia Clarkson. Directed by David Gordon Green. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Doctor
programme.desc: A fact-based story of a surgeon who learns the importance of compassion in a physician-patient relationship when he's treated for cancer. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez The Wall, Live from Washington D.C.
programme.desc: Comedian George Lopez performs in Washington, D.C., at the Kennedy Center. Topics include organic food, dogs in strollers and food allergies. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Big Miracle
programme.desc: Alaskan newsman Adam Carlson (John Krasinski) and Greenpeace volunteer Rachel Kramer team up to help free a family of gray whales that are trapped in the Arctic Circle in this drama inspired by actual events. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Time Traveler's Wife
programme.desc: Dramatic fantasy about a librarian whose genetic disorder causes him to hurtle through time when under extreme duress. Despite this condition, he tries to build a relationship with a young heiress. Based on the best-selling novel by author Audrey Niffenegger. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: A Dangerous Son
programme.desc: A profile of three families who are struggling with a child's severe mental illness highlights the cycle of counselor visits, medications, hospitalizations and encounters with law enforcement; and features interviews with mental-health experts and advocates. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Atomic Blonde
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in 1989 Berlin, MI6 agent Lorraine Broughton must obtain a stolen list of Western spies while the city around her descends into chaos and revolution. In time, her pursuit leads her to uncover a much-larger conspiracy. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Beguiled
programme.desc: In this Civil War drama, a deserter from the Union Army seeks refuge at an all-female boarding school in Virginia, where the ladies compete for his affections while tending to his injuries. His presence at the school slowly poisons the relationships between the various women, who eventually turn on the soldier. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Lady Macbeth
programme.desc: In 1865 England, a young woman in a loveless marriage has an affair with a servant on her estate. When her husband and father-in-law discover their tryst, the lovers resort to deception and murder in order to save their relationship. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Theory of Everything
programme.desc: This biopic of celebrated physicist Stephen Hawking explores his early years at Cambridge, where he fell in love with liberal-arts student and future wife Jane shortly before being diagnosed with ALS. As the years progress, Jane begins to feel more like a nurse than a spouse, and Hawking develops feelings for a woman who is hired to care for him. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: In this sci-fi epic, a paraplegic war veteran named Jake Sully volunteers for a mission on the planet Pandora, a hostile environment where human beings can only survive by remotely controlling alien avatars. However, Jake soon realizes that the Na'vi, a race of creatures native to Pandora, are being threatened by his own people, and he decides to join them in fighting back against mankind. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Atomic Blonde
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in 1989 Berlin, MI6 agent Lorraine Broughton must obtain a stolen list of Western spies while the city around her descends into chaos and revolution. In time, her pursuit leads her to uncover a much-larger conspiracy. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Beguiled

His presence at the school slowly poisons the relationships between the various women, who eventually turn on the soldier. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Logan
programme.desc: In a hideout near the U.S.-Mexico border, an aging Logan cares for the ailing Professor X. However, their sheltered existence comes to a sudden end when a young mutant girl arrives and needs their help to stay safe. This film is the third Wolverine-based spin-off of the "X-Men" franchise. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Being Serena
programme.desc: Serena gives birth to her daughter after an emergency C-section and reveals in detail the life-threatening complications that followed her delivery. Seven weeks later, she returns to the practice court and slowly begins her comeback. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: During the French and Indian War, a European man raised Mohican rescues and escorts the daughters of a British colonel, on their way to their father at Fort Henry. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Tokyo Project
programme.desc: A man discovers that the truth and the past are as elusive as love when he keeps running into a mysterious woman while exploring Tokyo on a business trip. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Fried Green Tomatoes
programme.desc: A neglected housewife makes an unexpected friend at a nursing home, where she hears a true tale about an independent woman in 1920s Alabama, who ran the town diner, served food to people of color and protected her sister-in-law from an abusive spouse. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include a one-on-one interview with Miami Marlins CEO Derek Jeter; a spotlight on coaching abuse among the top NCAA programs; and a feature on the Nebraska Cornhuskers women's bowling team. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Everything, Everything
programme.desc: A teenage girl is unable to leave her home because she has an immunodeficiency that makes her allergic to almost everything. However, her life changes for the better when she begins to communicate with the boy next door, and their relationship eventually inspires her to venture into the outside world. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: A Girl in the River The Price of Forgiveness
programme.desc: The story of an 18-year-old Pakistani girl who was targeted for death by her family but survived. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Under the Tuscan Sun
programme.desc: A bitter, divorced writer finds solace and romance after she impulsively buys and renovates a villa in Tuscany. Screenplay adapted from the memoir by Frances Mayes. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: This musical treat about murder, celebrity, adultery, flashy lawyers, starry-eyed chorines and all that jazz won Best Picture (and five other Academy Awards). Renee Zellweger and Catherine Zeta-Jones (Best Supporting Actress) do their own singing and dancing, while Richard Gere hoofs and croons as shady mouthpiece Billy Flynn. Chita Rivera, who starred in the original 1975 Broadway production, has a cameo as Nickie. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Snatched
programme.desc: A free-spirited woman convinces her anxious mother to join her on a vacation to South America she'd been planning with her beau before they broke up. However, their trip turns into a wild adventure when they escape from an attempted kidnapping. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
programme.desc: The romantic adventures of a thirtysomething Brit (Renee Zellweger) determined to find Mr. Right while cutting back on her smoking, drinking and eating. Charming and spirited. Hugh Grant, Colin Firth. A stellar Zellweger was nominated for a Best Actress Oscar. She perfected a British accent and gained 20 pounds for the role. Based on Helen Fielding's novel and followed by the 2004 sequel, “Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason.” Sharon Maguire directed. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: An Amazon princess leaves her island home and journeys to the outside world, which is being consumed by a massive war. With the help of an American pilot, she works to put an end to the conflict. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Something's Gotta Give
programme.desc: An aging Lothario falls for the playwright mother of his much younger girlfriend. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: The romantic adventures of a fashionable New York City writer and her three chic friends continue in this movie adaptation of the popular HBO series. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.desc: A reporter investigates a possible link between the CIA and the importing of cocaine into the U.S. in the 1980s. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Latin Explosion A New America
programme.desc: John Leguizamo narrates a look at the growing influence of Latino culture and music in the U.S. from the 1950s to the 21st century that features footage of vintage performances and remarks by artists and entertainers, including Marc Anthony, Gloria Estefan, José Feliciano, Eva Longoria, Jennifer Lopez, Ricky Martin, Rita Moreno, Pitbull, Shakira and Sofía Vergara. programme.title: Kong Skull Island
programme.desc: A disillusioned soldier and a photojournalist join an expedition to Skull Island, an uncharted territory in the Pacific. There, the group get caught up in an ongoing war between a gigantic ape called King Kong and the area's indigenous predators. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.desc: A Texas lawman pursues an escaped convict who has kidnapped a young boy. Meanwhile, in their dash to the border, the convict and the boy form a father-son attachment. (cc).

programme.desc: (cc).

programme.title: State of Play
programme.desc: Adaptation of the British miniseries concerning suspicious events that set a rising congressman and a dogged reporter on a dangerous collision course. A U.S. congressman Stephen Collins is ascending the ladder of power, but his bid for the presidency hits the skids after his research assistant/mistress is viciously murdered. Now top reporter Cal McAffrey is eager to get the truth. But McAffrey has just walked into a major cover-up. (cc).

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: Adaptation of the graphic novel set in 1985 America, where a cadre of forced-into-retirement superheroes investigate the murder of one of their own and uncover a wide-ranging conspiracy. (cc).

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: A Southern matron forges a bond with her black chauffeur in the racially-divided 1960s South. Only when he is retired and she is confined to a home for the elderly do the two fully realize that they've been friends and kindred spirits all along. (cc).

programme.title: A Monster Calls
programme.desc: A young boy befriends a wise tree monster while coping with bullying and the terminal illness of his mother. He moves in with his grandmother as his mom's condition deteriorates, and uses his imagination and friendship with the monster to escape reality. (cc).

programme.title: Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
programme.desc: Kids provide for themselves during summer vacation after their babysitter dies. (cc).

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy named Jake follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them. (cc).

programme.title: Four Christmases
programme.desc: When their annual vacation getaway falls through, a happily unmarried couple are forced to spend Christmas with the families of their four divorced parents on the same day. (cc).

programme.desc: (cc).

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: A bomber has rigged a bus with a bomb and a cop must get on-board while it is traveling to figure out how to get the passengers off. (cc).

programme.title: Terminator Salvation
programme.desc: Set in the year 2018, John Connor leads the human resistance against the computer network Skynet as the machines grow more aggressive than ever before. John was raised to believe in a specific version of the future, but that future begins to shift with the appearance of mysterious former death-row inmate Marcus Wright. As John and Marcus venture into the mechanical heart of Skynet's operations, they make a terrifying discovery about the potential fate of the human race. (cc).

programme.title: Birth of the Dragon
programme.desc: In 1964 San Francisco, a pre-fame Bruce Lee challenges a Shaolin monk named Wong Jack Man to a fight behind closed doors. This drama depicts this real-life event, which helped cement Lee's reputation as one of the greatest martial artists of all time. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: A single woman and a spy race to elude a federal agent and uncover the truth about a clandestine mission gone awry. Meanwhile, a CIA director attempts to discover why the unlikely duo have taken flight. Extended edition. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: A team of incarcerated supervillains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn, Enchantress, El Diablo and Killer Croc, are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Paparazzi
programme.desc: After an aggressive photographer causes his family injury, a hot action star (Cole Hauser) vows revenge. Clichéd and mean-spirited. Robin Tunney, Dennis Farina. Mel Gibson has a cameo in the film, which was made by his production company. Paul Abascal directed. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Cop Car
programme.desc: Two rebellious young boys steal a police cruiser and go for a joyride. But when they find a dead body in the trunk, they realize they must evade the car's owner, a corrupt small-town sheriff who's desperate to reclaim his property. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Super Troopers
programme.desc: A squad of Vermont state policemen battle local cops who are trying to get them ousted from the area. When state budget cuts are announced, the troopers set out on a huge drug bust, but the local cops are on a sabotage mission. (cc).(n)

programme.title: All About Steve
programme.desc: A quirky crossword-puzzle constructor falls for a cameraman and follows him across the country in hopes of winning his heart. (cc).(n)

programme.title: About Time
programme.desc: A lonely time traveler meets the love of his life, and attempts to win her heart time and again after a glitch in the process renders them complete strangers. Later, he repeatedly travels back to his past in order to perfect his present. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: Three female African-American mathematicians provide crucial calculations for NASA's space race against the Soviets, all while dealing with the racist and sexist assumptions of their white co-workers. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Dolores Claiborne
programme.desc: A big-city journalist discovers a terrible secret about her family's past after her estranged mother becomes the prime suspect in the death of the elderly woman for whom she had been caring. programme.title: Big Momma's House 2
programme.desc: FBI agent Malcolm Turner returns to don the wig and fat suit to become Hattie Mae Pierce, aka Big Momma. He goes undercover as a nanny to a domestic terrorist and his dysfunctional family.

programme.title: Drumline
programme.desc: An overly-confident drummer joins his college's marching band. The band, which puts musical tradition over entertainment, has little patience for his hubris, and he must learn to be a part of the team or risk being left out on the field. As he clashes with his band director and section leader, he finds time to romance the captain of the dance team.

programme.title: Juwanna Mann
programme.desc: When a pro-basketball star (Miguel A. Nunez Jr.) gets tossed out of the league, he dresses as a female hoopster and joins a women's team. The film nets too few laughs. Vivica A. Fox. Features cameos by NBA players Tyrone Bogues, Rasheed Wallace, Vlade Divac and Dikembe Mutombo.

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Sequel to 1995's “Friday” sends slacker Craig Jones (Ice Cube) on the lam to his lottery-winning uncle's house in the suburbs to hide from an escaped con (Tom 'Tiny' Lister Jr.). Day-Day: Mike Epps. Mr. Jones: John Witherspoon. Uncle Elroy: Don 'D.C.' Curry. Roach: Justin Pierce. Karla: Lisa Rodriguez.

programme.title: White Chicks
programme.desc: A social satire in which two inept black FBI agents pose as spoiled white socialites to uncover a kidnapping plot.

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Sequel to 1995's “Friday” sends slacker Craig Jones (Ice Cube) on the lam to his lottery-winning uncle's house in the suburbs to hide from an escaped con (Tom 'Tiny' Lister Jr.). Day-Day: Mike Epps. Mr. Jones: John Witherspoon. Uncle Elroy: Don 'D.C.' Curry. Roach: Justin Pierce. Karla: Lisa Rodriguez.

programme.title: The Players Club
programme.desc: Determined to get a college degree but overwhelmed by the expense of being a single mother, a woman who dreams of becoming a broadcast journalist resorts to stripping in a men's club.

programme.title: Living Single
programme.desc: The roommates and Max hit the town for a girls night out, while Kyle and Overton nearly come to blows at an all-guys' party during a televised prizefight. Russell: Shaun Baker. Jeffrey: Steven Gilborn. The Eclipse: Shashawnee Hall. (repeat).

programme.title: Living Single
programme.desc: Overton the handyman nearly gets Max evicted; an industrious housekeeper (Joseph Marcell) tidies up for the women roommates. Mr. Leon: Thomas Jefferson Byrd. Overton: John Henton. Max: Erika Alexander. (repeat).

programme.title: Living Single
programme.desc: Khadijah clashes with a hot new reporter (Duane Martin), who has his own methods of getting a story. Jim Brown appears as himself. Ivan: Bumper Robinson. The Eclipse: Shashawnee Hall. Off. Coleman: Lamont Johnson. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Martin isn't expecting a woman (Ajai Sanders) to go into labor in his apartment. Bobbi: Wendy Davis. Gina: Tisha Campbell. Pam: Tichina Arnold. Sean: Jonathan Gries. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Martin decides to act macho after Stan convinces him that Gina has been controlling his life. Kimberly: Monica R. Cooper. Robert: Keith Diamond. Gina: Tisha Campbell. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: When Gina throws Martin's basketball tickets away, she has to work for Sheneneh to get replacements. Martin Lawrence. Myra: Bebe Drake. Rhodesia: Kelly Jo Minter. Laquita: Simbi Khali. Gina: Tisha Campbell. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: After giving Gina's male friend (Darryl Alan Reed) the boot, Martin accompanies Gina to a shoe store. Martin Lawrence. Magazine Man: Abdul Salaam El Razzac. Gina: Tisha Campbell. Pam: Tichina Arnold. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: In the fifth-season opener, Doug receives a new job offer; Brandi is unsure about returning to L.A. following her fight with Shaunie; friction continues between Angel and Malaysia; and a reunited Tami and Reggie think about having a baby. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Brandi throws a party to welcome Duffey to Los Angeles. Later, Brandi's ex returns from China with hopes of rekindling their relationship; and Jackie surprises Doug with a new condo. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Brandi defends Malaysia's behavior at the party to Duffey. Later, Malaysia and Angel Brinks attempt to end their long-lasting feud; and drama between Brandi and Angel Love threatens to ruin Angel Brinks' launch party for her clothing line. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Angel Brinks' launch party continues as tensions run high. Later, Duffey gains respect for Malaysia when she arrives in sweatpants to defend Brandi; and Jackie convinces Shaunie and Brandi to meet each other. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Malaysia invites the ladies on a peacemaking trip to Big Bear Lake. Later, Shaunie and Brandi make up; and Angel Brinks becomes angry after her relationship with her child's father is questioned. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Angel Love starts a feud with Malaysia, Brandi and Duffey while on a trip to Big Bear Lake. Later, Duffey offers to direct a music video for Tami's daughter; and Jackie's attempt to mediate Duffey and Angel Love's argument only makes matters worse. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Angel Brinks plans an anniversary party for her clothing line, but chaos ensues when Jackie gets involved. Later, Tami and Duffey try to collaborate on Jazz's music video; and Jackie's heartbroken after she learns Doug's moving for a coaching position. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Angel Brinks hosts a star-studded anniversary party for her clothing line. Later, Tami and Reggie meet with a fertility doctor; and Jackie seeks advice from an energy healer. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Jackie's violent behavior at Angel Brinks' anniversary party causes tension between her and the Angels. Later, Brandi and Duffey plan a Dallas-inspired barbecue; and Tami confronts Duffey about her daughter's music video. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: A fight breaks out when Tami fires Duffey from her daughter's music video; and the Angels finally face off against Jackie. Later, Tami rushes to finish the music video before its release party. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Tami learns a scandalous secret from an old friend; and Jackie goes to extreme lengths to lose weight. Later, Angel Brinks is blindsided at a video-release party for Tami's daughter. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Jackie asks Malaysia to accompany her on the day of her weight-loss procedure. Later, Duffey apologizes to Tami's daughter; and Doug takes Jackie on a date, where he reveals a surprise. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: The ladies prepare for a trip to Portugal, as Malaysia attempts to make amends between Tami and Duffey. Later, Duffey has reservations about her decision to go on the trip soon after their arrival. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: The ladies explore Portugal and hope to relax, but Tami and Duffey's feud has everyone on edge. Later, Jackie fears the worst when she can't get in contact with Doug; and Tami finally confronts Duffey in a dramatic showdown. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: In the fifth-season finale, Jackie must choose whether Tami or Duffey is allowed to stay on the trip following their altercation; and pregnancy-test results could change everything for Tami. Later, Doug surprises Jackie with a dream wedding in Portugal. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives LA
programme.desc: Tami and Duffey reunite for the first time since their rooftop battle; Jackie attempts to defend her behavior; and Angel Love and Brandi face off. Later, Shaunie makes a declaration about her romantic future. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: In the Season 6 premiere, Evelyn moves to L.A. and reunites with her best friend, Shaunie, and her old nemesis, Tami. Later, tension between Evelyn, Tami and Jackie threatens to boil over at Shaunie's birthday party. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Evelyn and Jackie put their differences aside and move forward in their friendship. Later, Tami digs up new dirt on Evelyn in hopes of proving that she hasn't changed; and newcomer Bonnie-Jill finds herself in the middle of some drama. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Jackie throws a party to celebrate becoming a grandmother, but a confrontation with Tami spoils the evening. Later, Shaunie supports Evelyn as she begins her IVF treatment; and Tami hosts a book signing and leaves Jackie off the guest list, but that doesn't stop Jackie from making an appearance. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Shaunie attempts to broker a peace treaty between Tami and Evelyn. Later, Jackie hosts a wine safari to bring her old and new friends together; and Malaysia Pargo returns. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Shaunie, Tami and Evelyn meet up with Jackie to find common ground; and Brandi Maxiell returns to L.A. Later, Evelyn celebrates good news about her IVF treatment by inviting the ladies to Palm Springs. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: The ladies head to Palm Springs for a celebratory weekend. Later, Evelyn surprises Cristen with a makeover; and Malaysia invites a friend from the past to dinner, which pushes Shaunie, Tami and Evelyn over the edge. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Back in L.A., Shaunie, Tami and Evelyn regroup after being ambushed by Brandi in Palm Springs. Later, Jackie throws a "love your body" party to celebrate sexuality; and tensions boil when Cristen's sister arrives ready for a fight. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Jackie throws her "love your body party." Later, Malaysia feels snubbed by Shaunie, Tami and Evelyn; and Cristen divides her friendship with Jackie. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Tami interviews possible surrogate mothers; Saniy'yah throws a garden party; Malaysia confronts Shaunie, Tami and Evelyn on some boiling issues; and Jackie and BJ have words that push Jackie to her limits. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Malaysia spends time with her kids. Jackie finds Evelyn unhappy with her. Things come to a head with Evelyn and Jackie at a party that Evelyn throws for her magazine cover photos. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Tami suggests the ladies embark on a trip to New York City; Evelyn takes Shaunie on a trip down memory lane in the Bronx; Jackie pushes Evelyn to her breaking point; and all hell breaks loose at drinks. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: After the altercation with Jackie and Evelyn, the group is fractured. Tami hands over her "momager" roll when her daughter Jazz gets signed to a record label. Also: An uninvited guest makes an appearance at Saniy'yah's party. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Jackie attempts to broker a truce between Saniy'yah and Hazel. Jen Williams returns to the group. Evelyn and Jen talk for the first time in seven years. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Tami breaks some tough news to Reggie; Malaysia still feels divided from the group; and Evelyn and Jackie see each other for the first time since New York at Shaunie's “Women's Empowerment” event. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Shaunie invites the ladies to Miami to take a trip down memory lane; Kijafa Vick and Jeniva Samuel invite the ladies on a gorgeous yacht; Jackie is stuck on a boat with Evelyn and confronts Shaunie about an interview she did. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: In the Season 6 finale, Evelyn receives an advance copy of Ta'kari's manuscript and reads excerpts to Jennifer and Shaunie; tensions are high as Jackie and Evelyn sit face-to-face; and Shaunie and Jackie's friendship is tested. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Atlanta
programme.desc: Stevie stuns his family with a shocking announcement. Mimi and Keely attempt to mediate between Stevie's artists. Karlie encourages Rasheeda to date her hunky new trainer. Dime hears her baby's heartbeat for the first time. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Atlanta
programme.desc: Just Brittany's comment leaves Erica furious. Kelsie encourages Kirk to get his family back before it's too late. Keely comes for Sierra's clique. Momma Dee is back and going under the knife. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Atlanta
programme.desc: Just Brittany and Keely's friendship goes up in flames. Rasheeda sets clear boundaries for Kirk. Stevie wins Estelita back over to the good guy's team. Tokyo and Sierra plot to take down Keely. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Atlanta
programme.desc: Scrappy and Bambi are back in the A, and Momma Dee is already meddling in the newlyweds' affairs. A brawl breaks out at Tokyo's album release party. Tokyo suspects Tabius is cheating on her. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia

programme.title: Ranking Jankesa
programme.desc: Krzysztof "Jankes" Jankowski przedstawia subiektywny ranking tego, co najlepsze w sieci, muzyce, świecie show-biznesu i wszystkich innych interesujących rzeczy, którymi dzieli się z widzami.

programme.title: Mobmania
programme.desc: Program o nowinkach technicznych. Autorzy przedstawiają najnowsze gadżety, smartfony itp.

programme.title: Będę grał w grę
programme.desc: Magazyn skierowany do miłośników gier komputerowych. Jego autorzy omawiają i testują najnowsze propozycje, które trafiają na rynek.

programme.title: Miejska lista
programme.desc: Prowadząca program, Ola, odwiedza polskie miasta i zachęca ludzi, by wybierali klipy, które chcieliby usłyszeć.

programme.title: Weekend z Eską TV
programme.desc: Autorzy programu zabierają widzów do najciekawszych miejsc w Polsce. Przeprowadzają wywiady, pokazują kulisy swojej pracy, relacjonują wydarzenia, którym towarzyszyły kamery Eski TV.

programme.title: Podwójna Gorąca 20

programme.title: Jazdy Gwiazdy
programme.desc: Gospodarz programu Filip "Rudy" Rudanacja zaprasza do swojego garbusa znane i lubiane gwiazdy show-biznesu. Podczas wspólnej przejażdżki nie zawaha się zapytać swojego gościa o wszystko, na co ma ochotę i co chcieliby usłyszeć widzowie.

programme.title: Przesłuchanie
programme.desc: W każdym odcinku przesłuchiwana jest jedna z gwiazd show-biznesu. Twórcy programu zadają jej niewygodne pytania.

programme.title: 10 hitów 1 po 2
programme.desc: Twórcy programu w każdym wydaniu prezentują 10 wybranych hitów. Utwory, będące największymi przebojami najsłynniejszych wykonawców, grane są jeden po drugim.

programme.title: Bywanie na dywanie
programme.desc: Paulina Koziejowska i Aleksandra Kot zagłębiają się w świat przemysłu rozrywkowego. Opowiadają o bieżących wydarzeniach z show-biznesu, najświeższych plotkach oraz najgłośniejszych skandalach. Stałymi gośćmi programu są Adrian Nychnerewicz, redaktor "Super Expressu", który podzieli się najnowszymi wieściami z czerwonego dywanu, oraz Michał Kozłowski z Nowa TV, który zdradzi sekrety gwiazd sportu. Widzowie znają już obie gospodynie programu jako prezenterki prognozy pogody na Nowej TV, oprócz tego Aleksandra Kot od kilku lat jest związana ze stacją Eska TV.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Bywanie na dywanie
programme.desc: Paulina Koziejowska i Aleksandra Kot zagłębiają się w świat przemysłu rozrywkowego. Opowiadają o bieżących wydarzeniach z show-biznesu, najświeższych plotkach oraz najgłośniejszych skandalach. Stałymi gośćmi programu są Adrian Nychnerewicz, redaktor "Super Expressu", który podzieli się najnowszymi wieściami z czerwonego dywanu, oraz Michał Kozłowski z Nowa TV, który zdradzi sekrety gwiazd sportu. Widzowie znają już obie gospodynie programu jako prezenterki prognozy pogody na Nowej TV, oprócz tego Aleksandra Kot od kilku lat jest związana ze stacją Eska TV.
